War_graphs data set

Source: R/war_graphs.R
war_graphs.Rd

This dataset contains two networks where the nodes are countries and an edge in network "beligerent" means that the two countries have been at least once at war between years 1816 to 2007 while an edge in network "alliance" means that the two countries have had a formal alliance between years 1816 to 2012. The network `beligenrent` have less nodes since countries which have not been at war are not considered.

war_graphs

Format

A list with 2 two igraph objects, alliance and beligerent. Each grapha have two vertex attributes: 'name' (the country name) and 'military_power' (a score related to military power: the higer, the better)

Source

networs were extracted from <http://www.correlatesofwar.org/>

References

Sarkees, Meredith Reid and Frank Wayman (2010). Resort to War: 1816 - 2007. Washington DC: CQ Press.

Gibler, Douglas M. 2009. International military alliances, 1648-2008. CQ Press

Examples

data(war_graphs)
class(war_graphs$beligerent)
#> [1] "igraph"
igraph::gorder(war_graphs$alliance)
#> [1] 182
igraph::edges(war_graphs$alliance)
#> [[1]]
#> IGRAPH c364df0 UN-- 182 1694 -- 
#> + attr: name (v/c), military_power (v/n)
#> + edges from c364df0 (vertex names):
#>  [1] United States of America--Canada             
#>  [2] United States of America--Bahamas            
#>  [3] United States of America--Cuba               
#>  [4] United States of America--Haiti              
#>  [5] United States of America--Dominican Republic 
#>  [6] United States of America--Jamaica            
#>  [7] United States of America--Trinidad and Tobago
#>  [8] United States of America--Barbados           
#> + ... omitted several edges
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "igraph.edge"
